channel.title: [PI] Making my cache smaller
channel.description: Does anyone know how to reduce my cache size I have a few ideas to how but I'm not sure if they would work. I was thinking I could delete the models that aren't being used or going to be used or bugged but there's no way of knowing what models are what unless I move one at a time and figure out which models are moved which would take forever. I could get new cache that's smaller and find out which models it needs but I would still have to find some models and I never know if it's going to just be smaller because it has less models or if its going to be smaller because the models are just simply smaller file sizes. So that would be very hard and take forever as well. I could find a new client but my server only allows my client I don't know how to make it allow exceptions. I could delete customs but I don't know which models are for the customs and I wouldn't want to delete all the customs. I thought there may be a better compressor but if there was a better one than winrar available then it would've probably worked when I tried double compressing my cache. By double compressing I mean dragging a compressed .zip file into another empty .zip file. That just stayed the same or maybe went up a bit. I don't want to change servers so that can't be my solution. I like my server and I've spent a lot of time working on it. I could make make new models to replace the old ones. I'm pretty good with gimp but again I'd have to know which .dat files are which models. I could find an applet or something that finds out where a majority of my website visitors come from and put a mirror on a download server near the major places but I don't know any and I would probably have trouble finding download servers in all of the locations. The closer you are to the download server the faster the files download. I'm going to attempt this one until I find some better ideas. I'm going to back up the files then try using a defragmenter on the cache folder alone. My cache is inside my client but my client alone is only around 2MB so I don't need to worry about my clients size.

item.title: [PI] Making my cache smaller
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Compress all models in one file

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Making my cache smaller
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

U could find the models on google related to the .DAT files.
U can go into ur itemdef.java aswell and look for custom items you do not need or use.
So u can delete that models aswell.

Read full topic

@belhelmiel wrote:

Does anyone know how to reduce my cache size I have a few ideas to how but I’m not sure if they would work.
I was thinking I could delete the models that aren’t being used or going to be used or bugged but there’s no way of knowing what models are what unless I move one at a time and figure out which models are moved which would take forever.

The closer you are to the download server the faster the files download. I’m going to attempt this one until I find some better ideas.

My cache is inside my client but my client alone is only around 2MB so I don’t need to worry about my clients size.
